author: Pon Vasanth Arunachalam
text:
Three pilgrims from Maharashtra, who were sleeping on a parking bay on the Tiruchi-Madurai Highway , were killed in the early hours of Saturday in an accident involving a sand-laden truck.

The deceased have been identified as K. Sheela (59), A. Pramila (50) and R. Baby (55), all from Yavatmal in Vidarbha region. Nine others, who sustained injuries, have been admitted to the Government Rajaji Hospital here.

The group of about 40 people was on a tour to south India. They were planning to visit Rameswaram on Saturday, police said.

The bus in which the pilgrims were travelling was parked opposite a public sector bank at Katchirayanpatti on the highway and the pilgrims were sleeping on the road, police said.

A pick-up truck was parked behind the bus .

Police said a sand-laden lorry coming from Tiruchi rammed the truck while attempting to give way to a bus.

In the collision, the truck ran over the sleeping pilgrims.

The sand-laden truck collided with the tourist bus before coming to a halt.

Sheela and Pramila were killed on the spot, while Baby died at the Melur government hospital. The bodies were later taken to GRH for post-mortem.

C. Dhanapal (36), the driver of the pickup truck, escaped with minor injuries.

The Kottampatti police have booked a case against the lorry driver A. Sivaramakrishnan (25) from Lalgudi.

Madurai Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao visited the nine people who were undergoing treatment at the Government Rajaji Hospital.
title: Three pilgrims from Maharashtra die in accident
